class.name: BivariateGridInterpolator

javadoc.text: Interface representing a bivariate real interpolating function where the * sample points must be specified on a regular grid.
Compute an interpolating function for the dataset.
javadoc.param: xval All the x-coordinates of the interpolation points, sorted * in increasing order.
yval All the y-coordinates of the interpolation points, sorted * in increasing order.
fval The values of the interpolation points on all the grid knots:{@code fval[i][j] = f(xval[i], yval[j])}.
javadoc.return: a function which interpolates the dataset.
javadoc.throws: NoDataException if any of the arrays has zero length.
DimensionMismatchException if the array lengths are inconsistent.
NonMonotonicSequenceException if the array is not sorted.
NumberIsTooSmallException if the number of points is too small for * the order of the interpolation
